member.name: T:FSharp.Collections.Tree`1
member.summary: Represents a tree with nodes containing values an a list of children

member.name: M:FSharp.Collections.Tree.ofIndentedList``1(Microsoft.FSharp.Collections.FSharpList{System.Tuple{System.Int32,``0}})
member.summary: Turns a list of items with an indentation specified by an integer into a tree where indented items are children.

member.summary: Takes elements that are deeper (children) and turns them into nodes

member.name: M:FSharp.Collections.Tree.takeAtLevel``2(``0,Microsoft.FSharp.Collections.FSharpList{System.Tuple{``0,``1}})
member.summary: Takes all elements at the specified level and turns them into nodes

member.summary: A function that nests items of the input sequence that do not match a specified predicate under the last item that matches the predicate.

member.summary: Partitions the input list into two parts - the break is added at a point where the list starts with the specified sub-list.

member.name: M:FSharp.Collections.List.startsWith``1(Microsoft.FSharp.Collections.FSharpList{``0},Microsoft.FSharp.Collections.FSharpList{``0})
member.summary: Tests whether a list starts with the elements of another list (specified as the first parameter)

member.summary: Iterates over the elements of the list and calls the first function for every element. Between each two elements, the second function is called.

member.summary: Partitions list into an initial sequence (while the specified predicate returns 'false') and a rest of the list.

member.summary: Partitions list into an initial sequence (while the specified predicate returns true) and a rest of the list. The predicate gets the entire tail of the list and can perform lookahead.

member.name: M:FSharp.Collections.List.partitionWhile``1(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{``0,System.Boolean},Microsoft.FSharp.Collections.FSharpList{``0})
member.summary: Partitions list into an initial sequence (while the specified predicate returns true) and a rest of the list.

member.name: M:FSharp.Patterns.|Command|_|``2(``0,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{``0,``1})
member.summary: Lookup in a dictionary

member.name: M:FSharp.Patterns.|ParseCommand|_|(System.String)
member.summary: Utility for parsing commands - this deals with a single command. The key of the command should be identifier with just characters in it - otherwise, the parsing fails.

member.name: M:FSharp.Patterns.|ParseCommands|_|(System.String)
member.summary: Utility for parsing commands. Commands can be used in different places. We recognize `key1=value, key2=value` and also `key1:value, key2:value` The key of the command should be identifier with just characters in it - otherwise, the parsing fails.

member.name: M:FSharp.Patterns.|Let|``2(``0,``1)
member.summary:
Parameterized pattern that assigns the specified value to the first component of a tuple. Usage:
match str with | Let 1 (n, "one") | Let 2 (n, "two") -> n

member.name: M:FSharp.Patterns.Lines.|TrimParagraphLines|(Microsoft.FSharp.Collections.FSharpList{System.Tuple{System.String,FSharp.Formatting.Markdown.MarkdownRange}})
member.summary: Trims all lines of the current paragraph

member.name: M:FSharp.Patterns.Lines.|TrimBlankStart|(Microsoft.FSharp.Collections.FSharpList{System.Tuple{System.String,FSharp.Formatting.Markdown.MarkdownRange}})
member.summary: Removes whitespace lines from the beginning of the list

member.name: M:FSharp.Patterns.Lines.|TakeCodeBlock|_|(Microsoft.FSharp.Collections.FSharpList{System.Tuple{System.String,FSharp.Formatting.Markdown.MarkdownRange}})
member.summary: Matches when there are some lines at the beginning that are either empty (or whitespace) or start with at least 4 spaces (a tab counts as 4 spaces here). Returns all such lines from the beginning until a different line and the number of spaces the first line started with.

member.name: M:FSharp.Patterns.Lines.|TakeStartingWithOrBlank|_|(System.String,Microsoft.FSharp.Collections.FSharpList{System.String})
member.summary: Matches when there are some lines at the beginning that are either empty (or whitespace) or start with the specified string. Returns all such lines from the beginning until a different line.

member.name: M:FSharp.Patterns.Lines.|TrimBlank|``1(Microsoft.FSharp.Collections.FSharpList{System.Tuple{System.String,``0}})
member.summary: Removes blank lines from the start and the end of a list

member.name: M:FSharp.Patterns.List.|AsString|(Microsoft.FSharp.Collections.FSharpList{System.Char})
member.summary: Returns a list of characters as a string.

member.summary: Matches a list if it starts with a bracketed list. Nested brackets are skipped (by counting opening and closing brackets) and can be escaped using the '\' symbol.

member.summary: Matches a list if it starts with a sub-list that is delimited using the specified delimiter. Returns a wrapped list and the rest.

member.summary: Matches a list if it starts with a sub-list that is delimited using the specified delimiters. Returns a wrapped list and the rest.

member.name: M:FSharp.Patterns.StringPosition.|EqualsRepeated|_|(System.String,FSharp.Formatting.Markdown.MarkdownRange,System.String,FSharp.Formatting.Markdown.MarkdownRange)
member.summary: Matches when a string consists of some number of complete repetitions of a specified sub-string.

member.name: M:FSharp.Patterns.StringPosition.|StartsWithWrapped|_|(System.String,System.String,System.String,FSharp.Formatting.Markdown.MarkdownRange)
member.summary: Matches when a string starts with a sub-string wrapped using the opening and closing sub-string specified in the parameter. For example "[aa]bc" is wrapped in [ and ] pair. Returns the wrapped text together with the rest.

member.name: M:FSharp.Patterns.StringPosition.|StartsWithRepeated|_|(System.String,System.String,FSharp.Formatting.Markdown.MarkdownRange)
member.summary:
Matches when a string starts with a non-zero number of complete repetitions of the specified parameter (and returns the number of repetitions, together with the rest of the string)
let (StartsWithRepeated "/\" (2, " abc")) = "/\/\ abc"

member.summary: Matches when a string starts with the given value and ends with a given value (and returns the rest of it)

member.summary: Matches when a string starts with the specified sub-string

member.summary: A special addition for YAML-style frontmatter

member.summary: A special addition for computing paragraphs

member.summary: A Markdown Table

member.summary: A Markdown Horizontal rule

member.name: T:FSharp.Formatting.Markdown.MarkdownParagraph.CodeBlock
member.summary: A code block, whether fenced or via indentation

member.name: T:FSharp.Formatting.Markdown.MarkdownParagraph
member.summary: A paragraph represents a (possibly) multi-line element of a Markdown document. Paragraphs are headings, inline paragraphs, code blocks, lists, quotations, tables and also embedded LaTeX blocks.

member.name: T:FSharp.Formatting.Markdown.MarkdownEmbedSpans
member.summary: Provides an extensibility point for adding custom kinds of spans into a document (MarkdownEmbedSpans values can be embedded using MarkdownSpan.EmbedSpans)

member.name: T:FSharp.Formatting.Markdown.MarkdownSpans
member.summary: A type alias for a list of MarkdownSpan values

member.name: T:FSharp.Formatting.Markdown.MarkdownSpan
member.summary: Represents inline formatting inside a paragraph. This can be literal (with text), various formattings (string, emphasis, etc.), hyperlinks, images, inline maths etc.

member.name: T:FSharp.Formatting.Markdown.MarkdownColumnAlignment
member.summary: Column in a table can be aligned to left, right, center or using the default alignment

member.name: T:FSharp.Formatting.Markdown.MarkdownListKind
member.summary: A list kind can be Ordered or Unordered corresponding to <ol> and <ul> elements
Transform Markdown document into LaTeX format. The result will be written to the provided TextWriter.
Transform the provided MarkdownDocument into LaTeX format and write the result to a given writer.
Transform Markdown text into HTML format. The result will be written to the provided TextWriter.
Transform the provided MarkdownDocument into HTML format and write the result to a given writer.
Transform the provided MarkdownDocument into Pynb and return the result as a string.
Transform the provided MarkdownDocument into Md and return the result as a string.
Transform Markdown text into LaTeX format. The result will be returned as a string.
Transform the provided MarkdownDocument into LaTeX format and return the result as a string.
Transform Markdown document into HTML format. The result will be returned as a string.
Transform the provided MarkdownDocument into HTML format and return the result as a string.
Transform the provided MarkdownDocument into Fsx and return the result as a string.

member.name: M:FSharp.Formatting.Markdown.Markdown.Parse(System.String,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpOption{System.String},Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpOption{FSharp.Formatting.Markdown.MarkdownParseOptions})
member.summary: Parse the specified text into a MarkdownDocument. Line breaks in the inline HTML (etc.) will be stored using the specified string.

member.name: T:FSharp.Formatting.Markdown.Markdown
member.summary: Static class that provides methods for formatting and transforming Markdown documents.

member.name: P:FSharp.Formatting.Markdown.MarkdownDocument.Paragraphs
member.summary: Returns a list of paragraphs in the document

member.name: P:FSharp.Formatting.Markdown.MarkdownDocument.DefinedLinks
member.summary: Returns a dictionary containing explicitly defined links

member.name: T:FSharp.Formatting.Markdown.MarkdownDocument
member.summary: Representation of a Markdown document - the representation of Paragraphs uses an F# discriminated union type and so is best used from F#.

namespacedoc.summary: Functionality for processing markdown documents, converting to HTML, LaTeX, ipynb and scripts

member.name: T:FSharp.Formatting.Markdown.MarkdownPatterns
member.summary: This module provides an easy way of processing Markdown documents. It lets you decompose documents into leafs and nodes with nested paragraphs.

member.name: T:FSharp.Formatting.Markdown.Parser.ParsingContext
member.summary: Defines a context for the main `parseParagraphs` function

member.summary: Parse a list of lines into a sequence of markdown paragraphs

member.name: M:FSharp.Formatting.Markdown.Parser.|LinkDefinition|_|(Microsoft.FSharp.Collections.FSharpList{System.Tuple{System.String,FSharp.Formatting.Markdown.MarkdownRange}})
member.summary: Recognize a definition of a link as in `[key]: http://url ...`

member.name: M:FSharp.Formatting.Markdown.Parser.|LatexBlock|_|(Microsoft.FSharp.Collections.FSharpList{System.Tuple{System.String,FSharp.Formatting.Markdown.MarkdownRange}})
member.summary:
Recognizes Latex block 1. indented paragraph starting with "$$$". This is F#-literate-specific, not part of the usual ipynb way of putting latex in markdown. The "raw markdown" version of this (takenLines) has a \begin{equation} \end{equation} wrapping instead of "$$$"
2. Single line latex starting with `$$`.
3. Block delimited by \begin{equation} \end{equation}.
4. Block delimited by \begin{align} \end{align}.
See formats accepted at https://stackoverflow.com/questions/13208286/how-to-write-latex-in-ipython-notebook

member.name: M:FSharp.Formatting.Markdown.Parser.|EmptyBlockquote|_|(Microsoft.FSharp.Collections.FSharpList{System.Tuple{System.String,FSharp.Formatting.Markdown.MarkdownRange}})
member.summary: Recognizes a special case: an empty blockquote line should terminate the blockquote if the next line is not a blockquote

member.summary: Recognizes blockquote - continues taking paragraphs starting with '>' until there is something else

)

member.summary:
Matches a list if it starts with a sub-list that is delimited using the specified delimiters. Returns a wrapped list and the rest.
This is similar to `List.Delimited`, but it skips over escaped characters.
